page.title: 07RELIGION AT RINGSTEAD
page.content: Members of all denominations or none comprise the inhabitants. THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND now has one church-{ST.ANDREW,RINGSTEAD MAGNA,}now joined to the parish of St. Edmund, New Hunstanton;the Revd.John Larter, being the incumbent. The average attendance is 35,with a good proportion of children,who also meet as a group. There is also a weekly prayer group. {RINGSTEAD MAGNA,ST.PETER},is now only a ruined tower. Worship ceased here in the last century and the nave etc. demolished.An open-air service is held at St.Peter's tide. {RINGSTEAD PARVA,ST ANDREW}is also in ruins.The vicar is the Revd. Allton A former methodist chapel is now privately owned. All other denominations worship in surrounding villages.
